<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DEFENSE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/06/pentagon-cancels-controversial-jedi-contract-favor-multivendor-model?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Live Look at the Pentagon's JEDI Contract
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="The Death Star explosion from Star Wars" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/1xo9COytfPE9chS05b/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="The Death Star explosion from Star Wars" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/1xo9COytfPE9chS05b/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cancel culture strikes again: The Pentagon said yesterday it’s <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-06/pentagon-scraps-10-billion-cloud-contract-award-to-microsoft?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scrapping</a> its $10 billion JEDI cloud-computing contract with Microsoft and replacing it with another one that will require multiple vendors.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why? </strong>The same reason you throw out milk that’s been sitting in your refrigerator for a month—JEDI took so long to get off the ground that it spoiled. “With the shifting technology environment, it has become clear that the JEDI Cloud contract, which has long been delayed, no longer meets the requirements to fill the DoD’s capability gaps,” the Pentagon <a href="https://apnews.com/article/amazoncom-inc-technology-business-government-and-politics-83dae68a0ed4e24246900a1d1d1d00be?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> in a statement.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This story has it all</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Big Tech rivalries, Trump-era politics, next-gen warfare, the potential for Star Wars puns. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The goal of the JEDI project was to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/pentagon-plans-reboot-of-jedi-cloud-contract-11625589039?mod=hp_lead_pos2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">upgrade</a> the Pentagon’s IT systems, allowing the Department of Defense to streamline its vast troves of data and lay the groundwork for greater utilization of artificial intelligence. After an intense bidding process involving Amazon, Microsoft, and Oracle, the Pentagon awarded Microsoft the contract in 2019. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">That was just the beginning of the fiasco.</strong> Amazon challenged the decision in court, arguing that then-President Trump interfered with the result because he’s not a fan of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, who also owns the Washington Post. Then Oracle sued, claiming that the process was unfairly tilted in <em>favor</em> of Amazon. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What comes next? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Pentagon is replacing JEDI with the Joint Warfighter Cloud Capability (JWCC) project and opening up the contract to multiple potential vendors including Amazon, Microsoft, Alphabet, and anyone else that can prove they’ve got the cloud computing chops to give the Defense Department an IT makeover.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s an approach critics say the Pentagon should've taken from the beginning. A single-vendor strategy, lawmakers have argued, is not the industry standard and doesn’t make sense for mammoth cloud computing projects like this one.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/06/subway-overhauls-menu-bid-win-back-consumers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Subway: Lettuce Meat Your Expectations
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Starting July 13, you can add smashed avocado and fresh mozz to your $5 footlongs. After serving generally the same subs for 56 years, Subway is releasing its biggest <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/07/06/business/subway-new-menu/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">menu makeover</a> in history and rolling out a mobile app to lure back diners to its golden-scented restaurants.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"People were really crying out for food innovation. There hadn't really been a whole lot of food innovation," Subway CEO John Chidsey <a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/subway-is-making-major-menu-changes-but-keeping-tuna-2021-7?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But not </span><span><em>too </em></span><span>much innovation. Subway has decided to keep its “premium 100% tuna” sandwiches, which allegedly </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/19/style/subway-tuna-sandwich-lawsuit.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">don't have any tuna</a></span><span>, per the NYT.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some cold-cut knowledge:</strong> Subway is the largest fast-food chain in the US by number of locations (yes, it has even more than McDonald’s). But since 2014, its sales have nose-dived, forcing it to close hundreds of stores each year. While fast-food rivals enjoyed booming demand for contactless pickups during Covid, Subway missed out on that opportunity since fewer than one in 10 Subway stores had a drive-thru. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/06/nextdoor-announces-spac-expected-43-billion-valuation?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Invest In Your Nosy Neighbors
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/06/nextdoor-announces-spac-expected-43-billion-valuation?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Amy Sedaris looking out window with binoculars" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l0HUgRQaWnJIkxS6Y/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Amy Sedaris looking out window with binoculars" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l0HUgRQaWnJIkxS6Y/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nextdoor, everyone’s favorite app to ask the question, “Y’all hear that loud boom?” on, is <a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/nextdoor-go-public-via-43-bln-merger-with-khosla-backed-blank-check-firm-2021-07-06/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">going public</a> via SPAC at an expected valuation of $4.3 billion. The hyperlocal social platform was launched in 2011 and allows neighbors to share everything from food recs to safety updates. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nextdoor experienced <a href="https://www.axios.com/the-next-big-social-network-nextdoor-2bc336aa-e50b-4ea8-b097-f273bd5994d6.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">huge growth</a> in engagement during the pandemic as quarantineers 1) needed up-to-date info about school closures and vaccine availability in their communities and 2) craved gossip.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The company reported a 50% year-over-year increase in daily active users last year, and as of June, one-in-three US households are on the app, Nextdoor says.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nextdoor wasn't profitable in 2020, losing $75 million on $123 million in revenue.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> As the company scales and goes public, it'll be under greater scrutiny from investors to <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/07/01/886147665/it-s-our-fault-nextdoor-ceo-takes-blame-for-censorship-of-black-lives-matter-pos?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">address</a> racism and other toxic behaviors that have already surfaced on the app. Like other social media companies, it uses a mix of machine-learning tech and human moderators to supervise discussion.</p>

Key Performance Indicators

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>While average viewership for MSNBC, CNN, and Fox News fell 38% from the year prior in the first half of 2021, the Weather Channel audience <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/06/business/media/fox-weather-channel-plus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grew 7%</a>. No surprise, then, that Rupert Murdoch is planning to launch Fox Weather, a 24-hour weather streaming channel, later this year, per the NYT.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Should we sell it? Should we not sell it? What should we do? We’re kind of just holding on tight and waiting to see.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ines Mason, the owner of a 14th-floor condo in South Florida, told the NYT she’s concerned about the structural integrity of her building and whether she’ll be able to get a return on her investment in the property following the partial collapse of a condo tower in Surfside, FL. The disaster is starting to <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/06/us/florida-condos-insurance.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ripple</a> across South Florida’s sizzling real estate sector.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Is it time to give up caffeine? <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/06/employees-iceland-start-working-four-days-week?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Why Work Five Days When You Can Work Four?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/06/employees-iceland-start-working-four-days-week?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="a calendar with four days a week" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81Njc1L2ZvdXItZGF5X3dlZWsuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Along with the Northern Lights and the possibility of glimpsing the elusive Huldufólk, there might be one more reason to move to Iceland: in June, 86% of Iceland’s working population were currently, or on the path to, working <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2021/07/06/iceland-worker-study-four-day-work-week-productivity/7871364002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">four-day workweeks</a> with no reduction in pay.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The stat comes from <a href="https://autonomy.work/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/ICELAND_4DW.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a recent study</a> that tracked 2,500 employees whose workweek was shortened to 35–36 hours over five years. Researchers <a href="https://autonomy.work/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/ICELAND_4DW.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">found</a> that a four-day week with the same pay improved workers’ well-being and productivity. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The explosion of remote work during the pandemic has led to a rethinking of work-life balance, and more countries and even some companies in the US are experimenting with a shorter workweek.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Buffer, a social media software company, has let its 89 employees work four days a week since May 2020. The crowdfunding platform Kickstarter will test a four-day week for its 95 employees starting in 2022. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Both Spain and Japan are piloting a 32-hour work week over three years in response to changing perceptions of work during Covid. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line</strong>: Experts said the “overwhelming success” of the trial in Iceland could signal that a four-day workweek could gain traction far from the Arctic Circle.</p>

<tr>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nDEFENSE \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/06/pentagon-cancels-controversial-jedi-contract-favor-multivendor-model?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nLive Look at the Pentagon's JEDI Contract\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"The Death Star explosion from Star Wars\" !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"The Death Star explosion from Star Wars\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/1xo9COytfPE9chS05b/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCancel culture strikes again: The Pentagon said yesterday it’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-06/pentagon-scraps-10-billion-cloud-contract-award-to-microsoft?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003escrapping\u003c/a\u003e its $10 billion JEDI cloud-computing contract with Microsoft and replacing it with another one that will require multiple vendors.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy? \u003c/strong\u003eThe same reason you throw out milk that’s been sitting in your refrigerator for a month—JEDI took so long to get off the ground that it spoiled. “With the shifting technology environment, it has become clear that the JEDI Cloud contract, which has long been delayed, no longer meets the requirements to fill the DoD’s capability gaps,” the Pentagon \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/amazoncom-inc-technology-business-government-and-politics-83dae68a0ed4e24246900a1d1d1d00be?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e in a statement.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis story has it all\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBig Tech rivalries, Trump-era politics, next-gen warfare, the potential for Star Wars puns. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe goal of the JEDI project was to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/pentagon-plans-reboot-of-jedi-cloud-contract-11625589039?mod=hp_lead_pos2\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eupgrade\u003c/a\u003e the Pentagon’s IT systems, allowing the Department of Defense to streamline its vast troves of data and lay the groundwork for greater utilization of artificial intelligence. After an intense bidding process involving Amazon, Microsoft, and Oracle, the Pentagon awarded Microsoft the contract in 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThat was just the beginning of the fiasco.\u003c/strong\u003e Amazon challenged the decision in court, arguing that then-President Trump interfered with the result because he’s not a fan of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, who also owns the Washington Post. Then Oracle sued, claiming that the process was unfairly tilted in \u003cem\u003efavor\u003c/em\u003e of Amazon. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat comes next? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Pentagon is replacing JEDI with the Joint Warfighter Cloud Capability (JWCC) project and opening up the contract to multiple potential vendors including Amazon, Microsoft, Alphabet, and anyone else that can prove they’ve got the cloud computing chops to give the Defense Department an IT makeover.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s an approach critics say the Pentagon should've taken from the beginning. A single-vendor strategy, lawmakers have argued, is not the industry standard and doesn’t make sense for mammoth cloud computing projects like this one.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStarting July 13, you can add smashed avocado and fresh mozz to your $5 footlongs. After serving generally the same subs for 56 years, Subway is releasing its biggest \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/07/06/business/subway-new-menu/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emenu makeover\u003c/a\u003e in history and rolling out a mobile app to lure back diners to its golden-scented restaurants.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"People were really crying out for food innovation. There hadn't really been a whole lot of food innovation,\" Subway CEO John Chidsey \u003ca href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/subway-is-making-major-menu-changes-but-keeping-tuna-2021-7?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut not \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003etoo \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003emuch innovation. Subway has decided to keep its “premium 100% tuna” sandwiches, which allegedly \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/19/style/subway-tuna-sandwich-lawsuit.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edon't have any tuna\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, per the NYT.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome cold-cut knowledge:\u003c/strong\u003e Subway is the largest fast-food chain in the US by number of locations (yes, it has even more than McDonald’s). But since 2014, its sales have nose-dived, forcing it to close hundreds of stores each year. href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/nextdoor-go-public-via-43-bln-merger-with-khosla-backed-blank-check-firm-2021-07-06/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" The hyperlocal social platform was launched in 2011 and allows neighbors to share everything from food recs to safety updates. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNextdoor experienced \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/the-next-big-social-network-nextdoor-2bc336aa-e50b-4ea8-b097-f273bd5994d6.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehuge growth\u003c/a\u003e in engagement during the pandemic as quarantineers 1) needed up-to-date info about school closures and vaccine availability in their communities and 2) craved gossip.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe company reported a 50% year-over-year increase in daily active users last year, and as of June, one-in-three US households are on the app, Nextdoor says.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNextdoor wasn't profitable in 2020, losing $75 million on $123 million in revenue.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong Four?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/06/employees-iceland-start-working-four-days-week?utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"a calendar with four days a week\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81Njc1L2ZvdXItZGF5X3dlZWsuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAlong with the Northern Lights and the possibility of glimpsing the elusive Huldufólk, there might be one more reason to move to Iceland: in June, 86% of Iceland’s working population were currently, or on the path to, working \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2021/07/06/iceland-worker-study-four-day-work-week-productivity/7871364002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efour-day workweeks\u003c/a\u003e with no reduction in pay.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe stat comes from \u003ca href=\"https://autonomy.work/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/ICELAND_4DW.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea recent study\u003c/a\u003e that tracked 2,500 employees whose workweek was shortened to 35–36 hours over five years. Researchers \u003ca href=\"https://autonomy.work/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/ICELAND_4DW.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efound\u003c/a\u003e that a four-day week with the same pay improved workers’ well-being and productivity. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe explosion of remote work during the pandemic has led to a rethinking of work-life balance, and more countries and even some companies in the US are experimenting with a shorter workweek.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBuffer, a social media software company, has let its 89 employees work four days a week since May 2020. The crowdfunding platform Kickstarter will test a four-day week for its 95 employees starting in 2022. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBoth Spain and Japan are piloting a 32-hour work week over three years in response to changing perceptions of work during Covid. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line\u003c/strong\u003e: Experts said the “overwhelming success” of the trial in Iceland could signal that a four-day workweek could gain traction far from the Arctic Circle.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!--
